Patel and Verma found that high pulmonary ACE2 concentrations protect against lung injury.
39 The loss of ACE2 expression in acute lung injury led to leaky pulmonary blood vessels through AT1 receptor stimulation. However, hydrostatic oedema could not be excluded as a causative factor, emphasizing the need for further studies on the local effects of angiotensin II in lungs.
